results.title: In search of myself
results.brief_description: Considers the conflicts encountered by the people of the emerging nations who want to utilise the best aspects of technologically advanced societies but also want their progress to be uniquely African in nature. Young Nigerian authors, artists and musicians discuss their opinions and experiences.

results.title: In search of innocence
results.brief_description: A questioning filmmaker from Quebec finds out how Vancouver’s poets and painters look at life and art. Among the people seen are sculptor Donald Jarvis, painters Jack Shadbolt, Joy Long and Margaret Peterson, and printmaker Sing Lim. (Award: Chicago)

results.title: In search of home
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Nicholas Balla and Roger Blais
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Canada carries on”.
A film on child adoption describing how a welfare agency seeks to find the right home for each child placed under its care. How the agency goes about selecting good “parent material” is seen as two childless couples apply for adoption of a child. The first couple demonstrates the type of parental qualities looked for; in the case of the second, there is reason to doubt their ability to provide a healthy emotional environment for an adopted child. We see, too, the need for patient understanding of the delays and complications of placing the right child in the right home.

results.title: In search of balance
results.creator_credit: National Recreation and Park Association and Anthony T Lorch
results.brief_description: A film to make communities aware of the value and need for recreation and park services. Illustrates passive and active recreation, solitary and group interaction and structured and unstructured activities. Also reveals the many concerns of environmentalists and conservationists and traces the origin of recreation as we know it today.

results.title: In search of Anna
results.creator_credit: Storm Productions, Australian Film Commission, Victorian Film Corporation and Esben Storm
results.brief_description: Tony has just been released from Pentridge after serving six years for robbery. He sets out to settle old scores and search for his girlfriend Anna. In the process he hitches a ride north with the enigmatic Sam and a relationship develops between them. The theme of coming to terms with the past is expressed formally through the non-chronological structure which produces a split narrative - the Melbourne scenes and the journey north - which inform each other as the story unfolds. Underlying the journey to awareness is the city/country antinomy - the country has the power to liberate what the city has entrapped. Features the music of AC/DC, Rose Tattoo, Stiletto, The Angels and Steve Wright. Cast includes Richard Moir, Judy Morris, Chris Haywood, Bill Hunter, Ian Nimmo, Maurie Fields.

results.title: In search of a landscape
results.creator_credit: Hannah Dunne and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School
results.brief_description: The pre-performance preparations by Hannah Dunne and her dance troupe as they practice for their performance of “In search of a landscape”. Hannah describes to the viewer how she arrived at the name for this particular piece. NB: This video was donated by the performer and has a grainy quality. You do not need to adjust your machine.
